item.title: Hogwarts Legacy Players Discover Throwback Dumbledore Easter Egg
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Hogwarts Legacy contains Easter eggs, like a phoenix where Dumbledore's office used to be in older Harry Potter games.
  • The game draws inspiration from older games in the franchise, with similar movements, designs, and sound effects.
  • Fans appreciate the attention to detail in Hogwarts Legacy and anticipate more secrets in future releases.

A Hogwarts Legacy player discovered an Easter egg within the game that gives a small throwback to Dumbledore in previous Harry Potter games. With a wealth of previous Harry Potter content that Hogwarts Legacy has built itself on, there is no surprise that players are still finding callbacks to previous details from past games, books, and movies.

Hogwarts Legacy is filled with tons of tiny little details from the world of Harry Potter . Since the developers behind the open-world RPG are huge Harry Potter fans themselves, it is not surprising that players are continuing to find new Easter eggs in Hogwarts Legacy over a year after its release. With a ton of Harry Potter content for it to call back to, Easter eggs within the game range from minute details in the books to fan-favorite movie scenes. It also appears that Hogwarts Legacy contains throwbacks to previous Harry Potter games, especially with the Easter egg this player found.

Reddit user AdoraLovegood recently found a Dumbledore Easter egg in Hogwarts Legacy that calls back to previous Harry Potter games. The player found that within the Hogwarts castle, a phoenix appears on the walls where Dumbledore's office used to be in older Harry Potter games. The player shared a screenshot from Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince , an action-adventure game based on the film of the same name, next to a screenshot from Hogwarts Legacy . These photos showed exactly where Dumbledore's office was in the previous game and where the phoenix is in Hogwarts Legacy .

Hogwarts Legacy Easter Egg Shows Where Dumbledore's Office Used to be

Many fans thought the Easter egg was a cool touch and commented on how many secrets are hidden within Hogwarts Legacy . One player even mentioned how Hogwarts Legacy draws a lot of inspiration from previous Harry Potter games, as some of the player's movements, location design, and even sound effects remain incredibly similar to those from older titles. This trend of callbacks to earlier entries in the franchise seems to be continuing with the next generation of games, as Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions includes a PS1 Hagrid cosmetic in the game.

With a wealth of Harry Potter content that Hogwarts Legacy was built on, this player finding another Easter egg within the game is no surprise. As a sequel to Hogwarts Legacy is probably guaranteed to be released in the coming years, there will be plenty more secrets for fans to find.

item.title: GTA 6's PC Release Needs to Avoid One GTA 5 Controversy from the Get-Go
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The Steam Deck can handle demanding open-world games like Elden Ring and Days Gone , though some sacrifices may be required.
  • GTA V is not optimized for the Deck and this could result in Rockstar missing out on potential financial gains.
  • Having GTA 6 optimized for the Deck could lead to record-breaking sales for Rockstar due to the device's large install base.

The Steam Deck is a nifty device from Valve that allows players to game on the go. Though the machine is compact, it's quite powerful, and it has been able to handle many modern games. Gamers can check a game's playability by looking for the "Verified" seal of approval.

Grand Theft Auto 5 is currently unsupported, and many players complain that it is troublesome on the Steam Deck. This is an unfortunate situation, as being able to play GTA 5 on a portable device could equal a stream of sales for Rockstar. If the studio wants to kill two birds with one stone, however, it should ensure this mistake isn't repeated with GTA 6 .

The Steam Deck is Home to Many Great Open-World Games

The Deck is proof that dynamite comes in small packages. The tiny device has time and time again shown its ability to handle some demanding games, including those in the open-world genre. Elden Ring is a great game to play on the device for players looking for some tough action, while Days Gone is a delight for fans of the zombie subgenre.

When playing open-world games on the Deck, sometimes sacrifices have to be made. For example, the graphical settings may have to be turned down, or gamers may have to resort to playing at 30fps. However, in many cases, the sacrifice can be worth it, and most games manage to retain their beauty on the Deck's screen.

GTA 5 has the potential to be a great Verified Steam Deck game, but Rockstar hasn't optimized the game enough for the handheld. One of the biggest problems complained about on ProtonDB is the fact that GTA Online is inaccessible on the Deck due to the anti-cheat software being used. With a little tweaking, this could be changed, and the game could finally earn the "Verified" status, something that has the potential to be a financial boon for Rockstar.

It May Be a Little Too Late for GTA 5

If Rockstar wanted a Verified version of GTA 5 on the Deck, it should have acted fast. Currently, fans are looking ahead and eagerly awaiting GTA 6 . Consequently, gamers may not pay much attention if the 2013 game suddenly gets Verified. To avoid this problem, GTA 6 should be Verified on day one.

Gamers May Have to Wait a While to Play GTA 6 on the Steam Deck

GTA 6 is slated for a 2025 release date, though it's only been announced for PS5 and Xbox Series X/S. This isn't too much of a surprise, as Rockstar has a habit of releasing games on consoles first before focusing on the PC ports. This was the case with GTA 5 , and gamers waited roughly two years before the PC version was rolled out. This means that gamers probably won't be playing GTA 6 on the Steam Deck when it initially launches, regardless of whether it's Verified or not.

Rockstar has always had high sales numbers to show, and the studio will most likely be looking to make another record-breaking game with GTA 6 . Having the game Verified on the Steam Deck could help the game rack up sales, as the device has a large install base. The Steam Deck and GTA 6 could be a match made in heaven if Rockstar goes through the trouble of optimizing the game for the device.

The Deck has been around for a few years, but it still manages to thrive in the modern gaming landscape. Having GTA 6 Verified on the Deck would be proof that the handheld still has plenty of life left in it, and there's no need for a Steam Deck 2 just yet.

item.title: Civilization 6: Know Your Enemy Challenge Guide
item.description:
Sid Meier's Civilization 6 is one of the strategy genre's heavy hitters. It is an expansive historical strategy game that's seen a lot of developer support over the years in the form of updates, new game modes, new leaders and civilizations to play, as well as other content, such as monthly challenge modes.

The Know Your Enemy Challenge tasks players with defending China from Genghis Khan's Mongolia, and sees players take the role of Wu Zetian to work with Yongle and Qin Shi Huang to defend against Mongolia. The Know Your Enemy Challenge has a unique setup and play style that rewards a different kind of strategy than a typical game of Civilization 6.

Enabling the Know Your Enemy Challenge Mode

The Know Your Enemy challenge can be selected from the game's main menu. The challenge appears in the rotating menu on the main screen, and has two entries corresponding to the difficulty level of the challenge. Players looking for an extra challenge can choose the Emperor level Know Your Enemy Challenge, while players looking for a more standard challenge can choose the Prince level Know Your Enemy Challenge.

Know Your Enemy Game Parameters

The Know Your Enemy monthly challenge has a unique setup. The map is inspired by a section of land along the Great Wall of China. Here are the game parameters, which cannot be changed:

  • Difficulty: Prince / Emperor
  • Speed: Standard
  • Player Leader: Wu Zetian
  • Map Type: Custom
  • Map Size: Custom
  • Ruleset: Gathering Storm
  • Start Era: Medieval
  • Resources: Sparse
  • World Age: Old
  • Start Position: Standard
  • Temperature: Standard
  • Rainfall: Standard
  • Sea Level: Low

The game has 305 total turns, but begins at Turn 136, starting in the Medieval Era. This is a reasonably fast challenge to complete.

The Situation at Game Start

The player begins with one city, three military units, a spy, a builder, and a scout. Other players will be visible on the map at the start of the game, including the enemy, Genghis Khan. The player is given 6 Governor Titles , available to be used immediately, and receives a handful of Eurekas and Inspirations. The player has use of Wu Zetian's unique Leader Bonus, as well as the shared Chinese Dynastic Cycle Ability.

Wu Zetian's Leader Bonus and the Dynastic Cycle Ability

Manual of Entrapment Leader Bonus:

  • Receives a free Spy with Defensive Tactics, Spies can be purchased with Faith
  • Spies operate as if 1 level more experienced
  • Successful espionage missions in foreign cities grant 100% of Science, Faith, and Culture produced per turn by that city

Dynastic Cycle Ability:

  • Eurekas and Inspirations provide an extra +10% Science and Culture when gained
  • Completing a Wonder grants two random Eurekas and Inspirations from that Wonder's Era

Victory Conditions for the Know Your Enemy Challenge

The route to Victory in the Know Your Enemy Challenge is quite simple: last until the turn timer runs out, or destroy Genghis Khan.

Tips and Tricks for the Civilization 6 Know Your Enemy Challenge

Use the Governor Titles Effectively

A great first choice of Governor is Magnus, who can allow the player to build Settlers without spending any Population in the city where he's stationed. This is a massive help during the Know Your Enemy challenge since there aren't that many turns and Population is a precious resource. He can also boost the Growth Rate of the city where he's stationed, so it's a great way to pump out Settlers and keep the population growing.

Another good choice is Victor, whose abilities are good bonuses to military and defense - one of his promotions can even prevent a city from being put into the Siege condition. Other Governors are more situational, but Magnus and Victor are great choices for this challenge.

Expand Immediately

Expansion in Civilization games is always a must, but in this challenge particularly, it's more necessary than ever. The friendly AIs will expand, and quite quickly too. Because the friendly AIs start quite close to the player, their expansion can block off players who are slow to expand, directly impacting the player's ability to defend against Genghis Khan.

Resources aren't particularly abundant on this map, so it's also important to choose where to settle carefully. Prioritize new city locations that give access to important resources.

Use the Spies

Wu Zetian's Leader Bonus is heavily targeted to espionage and effective use of spies, so it makes sense to use this bonus during the challenge. The player starts with a Spy who can be used to great effect, whether they choose to steal Gold, damage enemy cities' Production capabilities, or reduce Loyalty. Successful operations will grant powerful promotions to the Spy unit, which makes subsequent spy operations even more successful and safe to carry out.

Use the World Congress Effectively

Although the World Congress can be safely ignored a lot of the time in games of Civilization 6, in the Know Your Enemy challenge, it can be extremely useful. Because Genghis Khan is the sole aggressor, any opportunity to pass resolutions targeting his ability to trade, or to pass resolutions affecting his Grievance generation and so on, are really good ones to take.

It can also be very worth using the Special Resolutions that pop up, especially if Genghis manages to take an allied city. This can grant a powerful situation with bonuses for players attacking Genghis Khan, which can really speed up conquest.

Use the Great Wall Improvement

The Great Wall improvement is unique to China, and it's really helpful in this particular challenge because it grants Gold production as well as bonuses to military units on its tile. This can be helpful in defending against the Barbarians on the map as well as Genghis Khan.

item.title: Frostpunk 2 is Already a Big Hit
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Frostpunk 2 has sold over 350,000 copies since its release on September 20.
  • This has generated enough revenue to cover all production and marketing costs for the city-building survival title.
  • Developer 11 Bit Studios plans to continue improving the game through patches and updates.

Polish developer 11 Bit Studios' Frostpunk 2 is so successful that it has already managed to recoup its production and marketing costs through sales alone. Frostpunk 2 fully launched on PC and Mac on September 20, with PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S ports set to release in 2025.

Powered by Unreal Engine 5, Frostpunk 2 is the sequel to 11 Bit Studios' acclaimed city-building survival game from 2018. The new release improves upon many aspects of its predecessor, offering players an even more challenging and complex experience that still takes place in the middle of a global volcanic winter. Data provided by SteamDB shows that Frostpunk 2 has passed the original game's player stats, so it comes as no surprise that the title has also outperformed its predecessor in terms of sales.

According to a post made on the game's Twitter account, Frostpunk 2 has already sold more than 350,000 copies, generating enough revenue to cover all production and marketing costs. In comparison, the first Frostpunk shipped 250,000 copies within three days of its release. Despite Frostpunk 2 's success, 11 Bit Studios' shares on mWIG40, a mid-cap index in Poland, have steadily dropped in value since the new city builder's launch. The title was expected to have significantly more players and a higher rating on Steam, Reuters reported, citing financial analysts.

How Many Copies Has Frostpunk 2 Sold?

  • 350,000 copies

On Steam, Frostpunk 2 currently has a Mostly Positive overall rating based on around 6,100 reviews. Meanwhile, the game has an average score of 85 on OpenCritic, making it one of the highest-rated 2024 releases on the review aggregate site, alongside other recent launches like Age of Mythology: Retold and Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 .

In another Twitter post, 11 Bit Studios acknowledged that Frostpunk 2 did not push boundaries, but the developer assured fans that it would continue to improve its latest survival experience through future patches. Hotfix 1.0.2, the most recent update for the game, went live on September 24 with various fixes and optimization improvements. One of the resolved issues caused buildings in Frostpunk 2 that were from different district categories to appear in the wrong tab. The next patch for the game will address issues related to audio performance and the DirectX 12 API.

A Frostpunk 2 -themed rover skin has just been added to the sci-fi adventure game The Invincible , which was also published by 11 Bit Studios. The latter title was based on Polish author Stanisaw Lem's novel of the same name and is available for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S.

item.title: Tekken 8 Reveals When Heihachi Mishima is Coming to the Game
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Heihachi Mishima will be playable in Tekken 8 starting October 1 for Player Character Year 1 Pass holders, and October 4 for everyone else.
  • Heihachi survived his supposed death by lava pit in Tekken 7, and will soon return as a playable fighter in Tekken 8.
  • Heihachi's debut will coincide with the release of a new battle stage called Genmaji Temple and a free story update.

Tekken 8 confirmed that Heihachi Mishima, the iconic villain of the series, will be playable starting on October 1 for those who purchased the Player Character Year 1 Pass. Tekken 8 players looking to play as Heihachi separately from the character pass will have to wait until October 4 Eastern time to take up the mantle of the Mishima Clan patriarch.

During the Evo 2024 tournament in Las Vegas, Tekken 8 producer Katsuhiro Harada shocked the world by revealing that Heihachi Mishima survived a fateful encounter at the end of Tekken 7 . The climactic battle between Heihachi and his son, Kazuya Mishima, resulted in the latter tossing his father into a pit of lava atop an active volcano. After the fight, Harada and other Tekken fans claimed that the leader of the Mishima Clan was completely dead. However, Heihachi's time in the grave was short-lived, as he was confirmed to return in Tekken 8 as the Autumn 2024 fighter of the Playable Character Year 1 Pass.

Thankfully, Tekken 8 players will not have to wait too much longer to play as the series' beloved villain. Starting October 1, Tekken 8 Playable Character Year 1 Pass holders will have early access to Heihachi Mishima as a playable fighter following a content update. Tekken 8 players who did not purchase the character pass will only have to wait a few days to play as Heihachi, as his official release as a DLC fighter begins October 4. The arrival of Heihachi Mishima in Tekken 8 was revealed in a gameplay trailer that showed the fan-favorite nemesis in action against various Tekken characters. Unsurprisingly, the banter between Heihachi and his son made light of their previous encounter, with Heihachi remarking that it would take more than a pool of lava to stop him.

When Is Heihachi Mishima Coming to Tekken 8?

  • Tuesday, October 1 (Early Access Via Year 1 Character Pass DLC)
  • Friday, October 4 (Official Release)

In the trailer, Heihachi showed off various combos against characters such as Lidia Sobieska and Eddy Gordo, who are also available in Tekken 8 's character pass. Heihachi will have four costumes to pick from, including his signature black gi as the default option. A new battle stage called Genmaji Temple will be available as DLC, and a free story update called "Forgotten Echoes" will be included once Heihachi arrives in early October.

With Heihachi back from the dead, Tekken 8 's current character pass only has its Winter character left to unveil. It remains to be seen how Heihachi will assert himself in the Tekken 8 meta against other formidable foes.
